Dear Mrs. Cnossen:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
12/15-12/17/2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is requiredThe
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)552-3662.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4125 Personal possessions; money; clothing; storage space.
(1) A licensee shall have a written policy that designates
all of the following:
(b)The method used to accurately account for and
return possessions and money to the resident or
guardian upon discharge.
2 of 4 closed youth files did not contain the form used to document the personal
belongings inventory.
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(2) The licensee shall document that each staff person
whose function is covered by these rules has
participated in a minimum of 50 clock hours of
planned training within the first year of employment
and a minimum of 25 clock hours of training annually
thereafter related to the employee’s job function.
1 of 11 employee files reviewed contained documentation that the employee did not
complete her required number of annual training hours and is currently on a
corrective action plan.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require any technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was provided regarding the resumption of staff tb testing as opposed to
completing the screening now that medical offices have re-opened for in-person
visits.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The only corrective action plan submitted by the facility administration was related to
the 2019 licensing interim inspection report in which they were cited for being in non-
4

compliance with R 400.4113(b) for having a photocopy of an employee
diploma/transcript, but not documentation to indicate that an original, official copy had
been viewed. The corrective action plan submitted regarding the citation was
successful as evidenced by compliance during this inspection.
The chief administrator reported that they have experienced a reduction in census
due to the current COVID crisis and requirements to maintain social distancing which
limits their ability to rooms and to have the full capacity of youth in the building. Other
than the challenges brought about by the pandemic, the youth and staff interviewed
reported no concerns with the facility or program.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rule. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
